title: Coal - global proved reserves by type 2010 to 2018
summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Anthracite and bituminous, and lastly, 2. Sub-bituminous and lignite.
The minimum Reserves in million metric tons about 319879.0, occured at 2018 by Sub-bituminous and lignite.
The greatest difference of Reserves in million metric tons between Anthracite and bituminous and Sub-bituminous and lignite occurs at Year 2016 and the smallest difference occurs at 2014.
min_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
mid_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
max_summary: Overall Anthracite and bituminous is gradually increasing, Sub-bituminous and lignite is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
Sub-bituminous and lignite reported the lowest Reserves in million metric tons about 319879.0 in Year 2018
The difference of Reserves in million metric tons between Anthracite and bituminous and Sub-bituminous and lignite is greater at Year 2018 compared to the Year 2014.
